title: Bug 7734: System can be shut down without savefile warnings
description: When a session is open with some opened, dirty .txt file, shutting down Windows will cause the loss of the changes in the .txt file.
OB: When shutting down Windows with a WSWB session open and a dirty .txt file, there is no warning or question message box to give users a chance to save their changes before the computer is shut down.
EB: When shutting down Windows with a WSWB session open and a dirty .txt file, a warning or question message box should be displayed to allow users to save their changes before the computer is shut down.
SR:
To reproduce the issue:
1. Start WSWB and create a new project.
2. Create a text file in the project and add a line of text to it.
3. Notice that the text file is marked as a dirty file.
4. Left click on the Windows Start menu and select the 'Shut Down...' command to shut down or reboot the computer.

Expected results:
- A warning or question message box should be displayed, giving users a chance to save their changes before the computer is shut down/rebooted.
